captions.text: [intro music]

Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, and today we're
making something that's incredibly impressive
but really could not be easier to do!

We
re making my salted caramel lava cakes. Now,

these are really ridiculously good, incredibly
indulging, you just make them once in a while

and they look really impressive, but they
really couldn't be easier to make.

We're going to start by making the actual
cake itself and to do that, you'll need just

a handful of basic ingredients like all purpose
flour, instant espresso powder, some salt,

granulated sugar, semi-sweet chocolate chips.
I've got a mixture of egg yolks and whole
eggs. You'll need unsalted butter and vanilla.

Those are all the ingredients you'll need
to make the actual cakes, and then we'll just

need a couple of additional ingredients. Now,
I have my oven pre-heated to 450F. I also

have six, six ounce ramekins that I have greased
with some non-stick spray. I have them back
there ready for me when I need them.

But for now, we're going to get going on making
the little cakes. Now, in my little sauce
pan I am going to add my butter.

It's like partially melted because I had it
on the stove and I had my oven pre-heating.

To the butter, I'm going to add the chocolate,
and I - if you watched the butterscotch molten

cakes, this is kind of the same thing. All
I'm going to do is put these together until
they melt.

Now, this won't take very long and do not
even think about turning this on high and

walking away because when chocolate burns,
there is no coming back from it - from burned
chocolate, it's terrible.

So, if it splits, because it will look like
it splits because the fat is separating from

the chocolate, don't worry about it. It all
comes together in the magic of when we mix
it all together. So don't worry.

All I'm doing here is just stirring until
everything melts nicely and then I'm just
going to set it aside to cool.
This looks great.

Everything is just about melted. There are
a few chocolate chips left but I'm just going

to let them sit there, and if they cool everything
melts together. It's like the magic of cooking

- something brilliant happens when you least
expect it. In this bowl, I'm using my electric

whisk here because it's just easy, I"m adding
my whole eggs and my egg yolks, and I'm going

to add my sugar and I am going to whisk these
together until really nicely combined and

then we'll get going on adding pretty much
everything else. It's really simple and really
easy, really straight forward, which I love.
Just adding a little bit of vanilla.
Mix that in.
Okay.

Get my chocolate, it's looking good - it shouldn't
be piping hot, otherwise it will scramble
the eggs.

And there are some chunks of chocolate in
there but do not worry. I mean think about
it, where's this going to end up?
Right in the cake, so, we'll live.

Okay, mix that in until you have a really
creamy chocolate-y mixture and then we'll
add in our dry ingredients.
Excellent.
I'm just going to take my flour.

I'm adding a little bit of espresso powder
because as you know, I happen to think that

anytime you add a little bit of coffee to
chocolate it just intensifies that chocolate

flavor. It doesn't taste like coffee, it just
makes that chocolate really shine.

I'm going to mix this together until it's
incorporated, not over mixing because we don't

want to develop any gluten, making this really
tough.
That is gorgeous, there is not a lump in sight.
That is what I want to see!
I'm like mesmerized by how good this looks!

I have my ramekins here sprayed with non-stick
spray. I have a little ladle here, and I'm

just going to take the batter and divide it
in my ramekins.
Oh, look at that!

I divided my batter evenly among my six ramekins,
some of it might have gotten on the baking
sheet but it's all good.

I'm going to pop these into the oven that's
been pre-heated to 450F and these will only

be in there between twelve to fourteen minutes,
no longer.

The tops and edges will seem set, but the
very center will still seem - you can see

that it's still really wobbly. That's what
you want, that's a lava cake.

I'm going to pop these in, and when they're
ready to come out, we will pull the whole
thing off together.

It's so easy yet so impressive, nobody will
know that it took like ten minutes.

My little cakes were in the oven for twelve
minutes and if you can see the edges are set

but the center is still somewhat wobbly, and
I have let this cool for two minutes - I've

let these cool for two minutes - this is going
to be really hot!

Now, what I'm going to do is invert this onto
a plate.

What I have here is some homemade caramel
sauce. Now, you can make your own caramel

sauce, and I suggest you do. I kind of took
a shortcut and made this already earlier,

just because, you know, I have an entire video
dedicated to it, so if you want to go to laurainthekitchen.com

and check out my caramel sauce, you will be
forever grateful. Because it is so good, it's

my all-time favorite and it just works really,
really well every single time.

So, I already have some homemade caramel sauce
ready but you can also use store bought. And

I also have some fleur de sel which is a lovely
French sea salt.

It's - all three together are going to make
for the perfect little cakes so I am just
going to take my little ramekin off.

I'm going to put just a little bit of my caramel
on top and let it drizzle around the sides
as well.

And now what's going to happen is when you
cut into this, the caramel and the chocolate

lava is kind of going to mix together - just
you wait!

And then that little tiny bit of sea salt
that - the sea salt, what this does - why

it's so crucial here, is that it offsets all
that sweetness.
So let's - ohh, look at that!
Are you seeing what I'm seeing?
Are you seeing what I'm seeing??
This is like a love affair!

And it should stop, between me and chocolate,
it's not going to.
Not any time soon.
I cannot wait.

It's like soft, and look at that. Oozing in
the middle. And it's just set on the edge.
I should quit my job while I'm still ahead.
That is the most incredible thing.

That little touch of salt, I promise you,
makes all the difference.

It's somehow not as sweet and as rich as you
think it's going to be. It's like the most

incredible balance you'll probably ever imagine,
and I promise you that this is worth every

little bit of effort even though it didn't
take very long, and you could definitely use

a short cut by using some store-bought caramel
sauce.
Go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get this recipe.

Give me a thumbs up and a like if you did
enjoy this video and let me know what you
want to see next.

I love reading your comments, especially when
it comes to wanting to sort of different takes

on specific recipes so let me know down below
and I so hope that you have enjoyed spending
time with me.

I'm going to go back to this because you have
no idea what I'm feeling right now. It's really
deep, and it's really exciting.

Hope you guys have enjoyed spending time with
me and I will see you very soon.
Bye bye!
[music]
[laughter]
I really could eat all this!
Look at it. It's like liquid gold.

title: Salted Caramel Molten Lava Cakes Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 784
